When Bioshock Infinite originally came out it was a mediocre shooter with a half decent story, Now its a mediocre shooter with an amazing story that is seen as so horribly "Problematic" that I am extremely surprised it hasn't been banned from store  fronts. 

*Infinites gunplay remains decent up until the final hours where the game will start shoving shotguns and rocket launchers at you left and right until it finally ends on a defense mission instead of having a final boss. 
*As the story goes i feel that it more then depicts the "Spirit" of the 1900's and the non combat parts of the game have a certain old world magic to them and the Partnership between Booker and Elizabeth was well done and remained interesting throughout the entire story.

6/10 - I wouldn't buy it unless it was on sale.

I will start with saying I played this game on Hard difficulty, this was my third playthrough of the game and my second playthrough of the DLC.

I wouldn't recommend buying this game, sure the gameplay is nice, but for me that, the setting of Columbia, and the art direction are the only good things in the game, the story, characters, and the DLC are all lack luster at best, bad at worst.

The only reason to buy this game is if you want more of the world of BioShock, but surprise, surprise the whole game has nothing to do with whats already established.

Side note, at least 3 out of the nine hours played in that game was pointless waiting and walking for something worth my attention to happen.

TL;DR- Don't waste your money.
It's not just a game, it's a work of art.

I wish I could have a neutral option for reviews but since there isn't I'm leaning more towards telling you it's not that great. Let's get the good out of the way, for starters the environments are awesome and very well put together. The graphical style of the game is also great and compliments the environment a lot. Lastly for the good the guns themselves are really nice with good modeling, sound, and animation. Now for all the negatives. First a more minor complaint, Vigor is just not as effective as Plasmids. The only ones I found myself using consistently were Bucking Bronco, Undertow, and Return To Sender. The rest were just crappier versions of Plasmids from the previous game. Next point is the biggest gripe I have with the title, difficulty and AI. You know how FEAR has some of the best AI on the market, picture the exact opposite. Enemies are completely braindead and the only way the game likes to compensate for this is by making them bullet spongy as hell. Granted there were some spongier enemies in Bioshock 1 and 2 but they were much more enjoyable to fight and had a much wider range of attack options. Going even further we have the gear and weapon limit. These just make the game so dreadful to get through considering in 1 and 2 there was no weapon limit and the amount of gear you could have on hand was exceptional. In Infinite you have a 2 weapon limit that can only be upgraded to 3 weapons total and you can only have 4 gear items equipped. You could say that in 1 and 2 that's overpowered but that's simply not true because the game progressed in a way where that didn't happen. In conclusion this game has an awesome narrative. great voice acting, and lovely environments but simply lacks the sheer amount of gameplay depth that 1 and 2 had and is just an absolute disappointment for me.

Before we start, let me say that i am mainly reviewing this as an entry to the Bioshock series.

As a game? It's okay
As a Bioshock game? Horrendously disappointing.
  Now let me preface a few things, i was VERY excited to play this game, i knew going in that it was not like the past two games, and i was read and open to have a new experience and story.
  Now the problem is.... i called the story HOURS before i actually got to the reveal, by accident. I was just thinking to myself and laughing "wouldn't it be stupid if....?"
The stupid things happened. The things i was laughing about because they were trope-filled and done to death were actual events. There's even these G-Man characters that pop up throughout the story and just be... annoying. That's all i really have to say about them.
I'm really trying to not spoil anything but i will say this... The reality is not linear, things branch. (unlike the story)

  Keep in mind, i went into this game blind, on a short binge of the bioshock games 1 through infinite.

  Gameplay-wise, i actually had a lot of fun. The game has a health system where you have shields that regen and health that doesn't. With this, the combat is much more action heavy, with large arenas and cover points here and there. All the guns felt unique, powers were fun to use....
This did not last long for me.
Combat became a chore around the middle of the game. Especially in the areas where the ziplines were a core mechanic, making battles a big confusing mess where EVERYBODY was zipping around and nobody, me included, was hitting anything. Plus, i never really needed any other power other than the fire one.
I played this game on normal, expecting it to be more fast and brutal like the old games, so it's not that i was on easy or anything....

  And yes i have to address Elizabeth. I didn't like her, at ALL. She's another done-to-death innocent damsel pretty girl with super powers, and one who seems to not understand the stakes of escaping??? There's a whole scene where she argues with Booker over killing people. Leading to something I am so tired of hearing "Nooooo killing bad!!!" "I'm sorry sweetheart, but as tough male protag, it is my way, we must do this if we want to live."

  I think i would have so much more forgiveness for this game if it didn't have BIOSHOCK slapped on the title like it has anything to do with the first two games (and don't get me started on the burial at sea DLC, i won't have any of that)

  I wanna say a few things in this game's favor though, it's not all bad, there was a LOT of work put into this game.
Presentation = Amazing
Voice acting = Great
World design = Breathtaking

  So my advice is this, if you LOVE Bioshock 1 and 2, do not play this. It is not Bioshock.
If you're going to play this as it's own game.... maybe? Maybe you'll have more fun than i did. Maybe the story will catch you by surprise. I think it's just because i've watched SO MANY movies and read so many books as a kid that i have this much experience with similar story beats. I'm a little jaded, to be fair. The set-pieces and story-heavy moments were actually very good (except for the ending, which made no kerflippin' sense at all, and happens so abruptly that i had to ask myself "Is that it?").

  Ugh.... the more I look at this game the more mixed i feel, and the more i want to rip into it. Just please make an informed decision before you buy this game. Maybe watch some spoiler-free gameplay videos and see if it looks fun to you.

I cannot describe the level of detail and world building this game has. Mix that with powers and powered gear to make fights more interesting and you also have amazing gun play. The story is a wild twist and turn.  What at first seems like a simple rescue mission turns into a complicated story relating to space and time. Highly recommend if you are looking for interesting gameplay or a good story. You will love it no doubt!

Good shooter with a nice time-loop story with a lot of plot twists. Plays mostly like an arena shooter where you destroy a bunch of CPUs every level, but if you die you continue exactly at same point - no checkpoints, enemies you killed will still be dead, which makes the combat feel too easy because there is no punishment in fact it is rewarding because you gain some salt (used to cast magic) and ammo when you come back to life. Also most magical powers you have feel very similar to each other, they stun your enemy and do some damage, you don't feel like you have a variety of powers. But it is still a solid shooter though it is surprising that this game has such a high review score because I believe there are better shooters out there.

Vay be... hiç böyle bir oyundan tatmin olacağımı tahmin edemezdim.

BioShock Infinite hayatımda oynadığım en iyi oyunlardan birisi desem yanlış olmaz. Gerçekten çok bayıldım... Ben BioShock serisine hep başlamak istiyordum ve almayı planlıyordum ve 1-2 ay önce şansıma BioShock Collection paketi indirime girdi sadece 24 liraya. Bende aldım ve ilk BioShock 1 den başladım sonuçta serinin ilk oyunuydu. Ancak ben BioShock 1 den çok tatmin olamadım zaten oyunu sadece 2 saat oynadım ve oyunda takılı kaldım. Sonra da öyle kaldı oyunu hiç açamaz hale geldim. Diğer başka oyunlara yöneldim ben o günler de. BioShock 2 yi ise hiç açmadım zaten ama BioShock Infinite i çok oynamak istiyordum. Serinin en iyi oyunu diyenler var Infinite'e, en iyi FPS oyunlarından birisi olarak gösteriliyordu. Tabi birinci oyunu da öyle gösteriyordu ve ben ondan hiç tatmin olamadım ve bu yüzden bir şüpheye düştüm, acaba BioShock Infinite'e demi aynısı olurdu diye, Ben Infinite'i ilk iki oyunun sonrasını anlatıyor diye düşündüğüm için hala birinci oyununu oynamam gerekiyordu. Ancak sonra dan öğrendim ki BioShock Infinite devam oyunu değilmiş. Bu iki oyunun dışında kalıyor. Bende fırsatımı burada kullanarak Infinite'e başladım, eğer bundan da tatmin olamasaydım oyunu direk silecektim zaten öyle duracaktı kütüphanem de.

Ama yanıldım...

BioShock Infinite beni baya etkiledi. Beni bir oyun etkileyince benim için özel oyunlardan birisi olabiliyor. Hayır, burada oyuna başyapıt demiyorum, hiç bir oyun başyapıt değildir. Nereden başlasam övmeye bilemiyorum... Hikaye den başlıyorum. Oyunun hikayesi mükemmel, gerçekten mükemmel... Benim uzun zamandır böyle bir oyuna ihtiyacım varmış gibi hissediyorum... Hikayeyi hiç özetlememe gerek yok zaten popüler incelemelerde güzelce özetlenmiş. Kendime bile inanamıyorum ama ben bir oyunu gün de genelde bitirecek isem 1-2 saat oynarım bu yüzden bitirmem zaman alır. Ama BioShock Infinite'e 2 gün önce başladım, o gün 1 saat oynadım, dün 4 saat oynadım ve bugün de 4 saat oynayarak oyunu bitirdim, 9 saat de bitti ve 9 saat buna değdi, Aslında 10-11 saate bitiririm diye düşünüyordum ama 9 saat beni şaşırttı. Gerçekten oyunu oynadığım her zaman beni başından kaldıramadı, gerçekten çok eğlendim ya. Aynı Portal 2'yi ilk kez oynadığım zamanları hatırlattı, onun başından hiç kalkamıyordum zamanın da. BioShock Infinite'in başı zaten beni oyunda tutmayı başardı. 

Oyunun oynanışı baya güzel, hikayesi ve senaryosu zaten çok çok iyi, oyunda ki atmosfer bir oyunda gördüğüm en iyi atmosterlerden birisi. Oyunun başını oynarken Columbia'ya geldiğim de şu sözleri söylemiştim "Oha anasının amı" ekran görüntüsü bile aldım, oyunun öyle manzaraları var ki ekran görüntüsü almak istiyorsunuz birden. Oyunun vuruş hissi çok iyi, bir çok silah çeşidi var oyun da ve bunların her biri çok iyi, ayrıca yetenek sistemi var aynı ilk oyunda ki gibi, 8 tane yeteneğiniz oluyor oyun da ilerledikçe. Bunları hatta geliştirebiliyoruz bir makine ile ama para lazım, Etrafta 3 tane farklı makine var, birisinden mermi, can, salt (yetenekleri kullanabilmek için gerekli bir bar şeysi) alabiliyorsunuz, diğer birinden yeteneklerinizi geliştiriyorsunuz ve diğer birinden ise silah kullanma yeteneklerinizi geliştirebiliyorsunuz, paranızı tabi iyi harcayın, ve aklınız da olsun her öldüğünüzde para kaybediyorsunuz, ölmemeye çalışın. Oyunda ki ana karakterler gerçekten çok iyi, Booker DeWitt ve Elizabeth benim aklımda kalanlardan oldu ki Booker DeWitt'i şuan da Discord profil fotoğrafım olarak kullanıyorum. 

Kesinlikle alın ve oynayın, indirim de bu oyun 12 liraya düşüyor hatta direk BioShock Collection 24 liraya düşüyor onu da alabilirsiniz. Ben bu oyundan bir süre ayrılamayacağım gibi görünüyor...

Hra kde sa stretáva minulosť, súčasnosť a budúcnosť. Veľmi podarený príbeh pána s menom Booker DeWitt ktorý má za úlohu splatiť svoj dlh tým že privedie mladé dievča Elizabeth so sveta nad našim svetom tzv. utópiu ktorú vedie Father Comstock ktorý chce s Elizabeth učiniť svoju následníčku a preto ju drží mimo okolný svet. 
DeWitt v priebehu hry odhaľuje Elizabetinu minulosť, vznik mesta Columbia ktoré sa vznieslo na oblohu a bolo takou utópiou (avšak iba na prvý pohľad). Hra sa hrá s myšlienkou cestovania časom a zmenou budúcnosti. 
Koniec som rozhodne nečakal a veľmi ma prekvapil.

Ako povedala Elizabeth:  "There's always a man, always a lighthouse, always a city." 
Musím priznať že je tam malá náveznosť na predchádzajúce diely a taktiež je okolo tejto hry zopár teórií ohľadom jedného veľkého multiverza (čo sa nám v hre s časti ukázalo a preto s touto teóriou súhlasím).

Za mňa si hra zaslúži pekných 9/10. Nemala síce na pôvodný Bioshock 1 ale ani táto hra rozhodne neurazí a fanúšikov série prekvapý kopou tajomstiev a teórií.
So good!

The third installment in the Bioshock series and the most creative one by a landslide. Bioshock Infinite takes a whole lot of steps forward and a handful back from its predecessors. Overall I'll say it's the best one in the series and entirely separated from the previous two Bioshocks(take 1 throwback).

In terms of gameplay Bioshock Infinite streamlines the old "quickswap" gameplay Bioshock 1 and 2 had in favor of a much simpler system with better gunplay. Consequently the game loses a lot of depth to make it more appealing to a wider crowd. I personally dislike this choice, but I can understand that is what newer times demand. You can now equip up to 2 weapons and 2 "Vigors"(the equivalent of "Plasmids"). As is presumably a throwback to the original Bioshock you should probably just stick with lightning and some complementary ability. Due to the limited choice in concurrent weapons/abilities you can now conveniently swap them with a single button press. It's easy to pilot but does feel a little bland after a while.

Infinity's worst enemy is visual clarity and a lack of consistency(gameplay wise); you will very frequently be shooting at enemies you can barely see or get shot in the back because enemies spawn from absolutely everywhere. There are also a lot of "suckerpunch"-like encounters where the situation gives you no real time to adapt to what is going on. The "Handyman"(obvious equivalent of and throwback to the Big daddies) are a big offender in this. As a result combat floats between piss easy and really chaotic. The game was never truly challenging for me on "normal". The reason I opted for "normal"(from three options) is what brings me to an important difference between Infinite and it's predecessors; resource management. In Bioshock 1 and 2 resource management was a huge deal as in System shock tradition. This has been pruned almost entirely much to my liking. I feared Infinite would be as stingy in giving out ammunition as the previous games were.

The sound design is very good. The graphics are very good. The environmental art is lovely. The world building is a little bit... too obvious. The voice acting is top shelf throughout the entire game. The characters, if not a little bit too obvious, are generally well written. Some encounters will come off as a little cliche/forced whereas others are genuinely witty and surprising. The story twists and turns like we're used to from Bioshock, but in a much, much more shocking way. I don't think it'll be easy to outdo Infinite in that regard. They depict the protagonist as rather boorish, which allows you as player to catch up with things much faster than he does - but the game still manages to make a fool of you after the arrogance firmly kicked in. I don't think any game has ever achieved this for me outside of Bioshock Infinite.

Booker is the crude, dogged and rather boorish protagonist. You'll go from liking, to disliking, to liking to hating him if you're anything like me. Elizabeth is a little more subtle in terms of character writing. You'll really grow attached to the latter through how the game integrated her in the core gameplay loop and occasional dialogue interactions. Even though I found some of the mechanics associated with her very jarring and somewhat obnoxious I did not mind the repeated "here Booker I found X!"(which has spawned a bit of a meme). Having Elizabeth throw a rifle at you while you're firing at hostiles is an action movie come true.

The story arcs from cliche and outlandish to "a little too slow" before hitting you with a hammer in the end. It's not one you'll forget easily, at least mostly for good reasons(can't say that I'm entirely convinced however).

Overall Bioshock Infinite stands as, in my opinion, the best entry in the Bioshock series. It's nowhere near perfect but manages to pull off quite a few things other games can only dream of.

여느 값만 비싼 양장본 책값보다 싼 가격에 사서 그 이상의 인상을 받은 것 같다. 
세일 받아서 산게 미안할 정도로 몰입갑있게 즐겼다.

好
游戏场景很美。
its a masterpiece
抛开唯美的画面、优良的游戏机制以及穿插其中别有特色的配乐不谈，对于这部7年前的作品，如果将其剧情提炼并适当压缩，制作成一部电影，其水准能与诺兰编导的科幻片相当。
结尾一身鸡皮疙瘩 太赞了，我爱伊丽莎白！！！！

作为一个不善言谈的死肥宅，我还从来没有给游戏写过评论。《生化奇兵》也许不是我游戏时间最长的，但她带给我了一种奇妙的体验与感动。
我是一个剧情向而非收集向的玩家，所以游戏时间只有短短八个小时。但游戏中的种种设定和脑洞，环环相扣，节奏感把握的十分棒，游戏性没的说。魔药的设定以及大量的特色武器，也增强了游戏的可玩性。
原本其中的一些剧情就已经足够震撼，比如游乐场里的战斗，亦或是林辰的剧情等等，每到一个新的章节，就会有新的体验，能将这种新鲜感保持住的游戏实在不多。而终章的剧情更加让人叹为观止：在无限的时间当中，布克和伊丽莎白，是一种叠加的状态。而在伤膝河的洗礼，将这一切推向了高潮——他们毁灭了自己。对于困于时间长河的两人来说，这或许是最好的结局。
一开始并不喜欢这种漫画风格，喜欢使命召唤那种写实风格的。但是这游戏的画面和创意设计太好了，还有最神秘NPC伊丽莎白，剧情一直会牵着你走，总想一直玩。先在switch玩的，又在PC打折的时候买了。1代过于黑暗，3代是天堂画面下的黑暗，反差设计挺好的，有些美术设计特别惊人。总之是非常奇特不可多得的好游戏。
